III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth is self-harming by cutting themselves and carving words
into their skin. The staff is aware and do not take action.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed by phone on 03/07/2025.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 03/11/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth A agreed
and pulled up the long sleeves of her sweatshirt and revealed no
markings on her right forearm but markings on her left forearm.
The markings are “Dad ♡ XX”. (XX are not the actual two letters,
rather coded for confidentiality.) The markings are without blood or
broken skin with the XX barely visible. Youth A states she made
the markings in her Unit 2B room at the end of 01/2025 or early
02/2025 using a twist tie from a decorative holiday bow. Youth A
compared the twist tie to the twist tie with a metal thread inside
that secures a bread bag closed. Youth A stated she checked to
make sure that staff did not witness her make the markings on her
arm because she does not want to be placed on close
observation. Youth A stated she does not currently have thoughts
of self-harm or writing on her body and agreed to notify staff if
thoughts occur. Youth A stated she no longer has the metal thread
from the twist tie because she dropped it in her room and never
found it.
Youth B was interviewed on 03/11/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth B stated
she resides on Unit 2B. Youth B stated she has not witnessed
youths self-harm at Wayne County Juvenile Detention but would
notify staff if it occurred.
2

Staff 1 was interviewed on 03/11/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated Youth A
usually wears long sleeves that cover her arms. Staff 1 stated she
never observed Youth A self-harm but noticed a pink mark on one
of her arms about two weeks ago that looked like it was made by
an eraser. Staff 1 stated she does not recall the look of the mark
but the mark did not break skin or bleed. Staff 1 stated Youth A
told her the mark was about her dad and that she made the mark
a while ago. Staff 1 stated the nurse gave Youth A Vaseline or an
ointment to put on the mark.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 03/11/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS Worker. Staff 2 stated she never
witnessed Youth A self-harm. Staff 2 stated she never noticed
markings on Youth A’s arms because she always wears a long
sleeve sweatshirt. Staff 2 stated she would address the youth and
notify a supervisor or manager if she observed a youth self-
harming.
Therapist was interviewed on 03/11/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Therapist stated
Youth A did not report self-harm behaviors to her, however, she
addressed it with her on 03/10/2025 after a supervisor or manager
requested it in light of this investigation. Therapist stated Youth A
told her that she used a twist tie to write the words on her arm
when she was in her room and not in staff’s line of sight.
Documentation
Deputy Director stated by email on 03/18/2025 that Youth A does
not have incident reports about self-harm and does not have
nursing progress notes about being assessed or treated for self-
harm.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as there is not enough
information to make a conclusive determination. Youth A states
she made the markings on her left forearm in her room and
ensured staff did not witness it.
CONSULTATION
Continue to monitor and assess Youth A for self-harm and
contraband.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
3

Rule Code Resident nutrition.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4149
Section (1) A licensee shall provide a minimum of 3 nutritious edible meals
Description daily unless medically contraindicated and documented.
Violation Additional Allegation of Non-Compliance
Type
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed on 03/11/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth A made an
additional allegation that the meat in goulash is not fully cook.
Youth A stated the goulash meat was pink in color but did not
know the date this occurred. Youth A further stated any ground
meat served at Wayne County Juvenile Detention is light pink
inside, indicating it is not fully cooked.
Youth B was interviewed on 03/11/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth B stated
she has eaten goulash at Wayne County Juvenile Detention.
Youth B was asked to describe the meat in the goulash. Youth B
stated the goulash meat was gray in color on the outside and
inside. Youth B did not express concerns of ground meat not
being fully cooked.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were interviewed separately on 03/11/2025 at
Wayne County Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 stated they work on Unit 2B. Staff 1 and Staff 2
stated Unit 2B youths have not reported meat being undercooked
and they have not witnessed undercooked meat served.
Observation
On 03/21/2025 Unit 2B youths ate cheeseburgers for lunch. A
half-eaten hamburger patty of a cheeseburger was checked. The
hamburger patty was gray in color on the outside and inside.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance in serving thoroughly cooked
meat.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
4

Rule Code Water supply.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4414
Section (2) Each sink, lavatory, bath, shower, drinking fountain, and other
Description water outlet shall be supplied with safe and potable water which is
sufficient in quantity and pressure to meet the conditions of peak
demand. Hot and cold or tempered water shall be provided in each
sink, lavatory, bath, and shower. Hot water temperatures shall not
exceed 120 degrees Fahrenheit at outlets accessible to residents.
Violation Additional Allegation of Non-Compliance
Type
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed on 03/11/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth A made an
additional allegation that the water from Unit 2B’s sinks in youth
rooms comes out cloudy.
Youth B was interviewed on 03/11/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth B stated the
water from Unit 2B’s sinks in youth room comes out cloudy. Youth
B states she gets her drinking water from the sink in the common
area, which is not cloudy.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were interviewed separately on 03/11/2025 at
Wayne County Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 stated they work on Unit 2B. Staff 1 and Staff 2
stated youths have not reported their room sinks dispense cloudy
water. Staff 1 stated youths are able to get drinking water from the
common area sink.
Observation
A paper cup was obtained from health services on 03/21/2025 and
then filled with water from Unit 2B room 3’s sink, which was
randomly selected. The water dispensed from the sink was clear
and filled the paper cup with clear water.
Documentation
Wayne County Juvenile Detention received a rating of A on their
environmental inspection completed on 01/22/2025. Wayne
County Juvenile Detention has access to a municipal water
system.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with youths being able to
access drinking water from their room sink or from the common
5

area sink. The water on Unit 2B room 3 was clear when sampled
on 03/21/2025 and the facility passed their health inspection.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
